HomePage.faqTitle: Frequently Asked Questions About UPI Payments in India
HomePage.faq1Answer: Yes, UPI PG is completely free for generating individual payment links and QR codes. We believe in making digital payments simple and accessible for everyone in India.
HomePage.faq2Question: Do I need a bank account to use this?
HomePage.faq2Answer: You need a UPI ID, which is linked to your bank account via UPI apps like Google Pay, PhonePe, Paytm, Amazon Pay, or your bank's own BHIM UPI app. Our service generates a link or QR code that the payer uses; we never ask for your bank account details.
HomePage.faq3Question: Can I generate a UPI QR code without an amount?
HomePage.faq3Answer: Currently, our tool is designed as a UPI QR code generator with amount included to simplify the payment process for Indian merchants and businesses. You must specify an amount to generate a link.
HomePage.faq4Question: Is this an official NPCI or BHIM UPI QR code generator?
HomePage.faq4Answer: We are an independent platform that uses the standard UPI protocol defined by NPCI. We provide a simple interface to create payment links and QR codes that work across the entire Indian UPI ecosystem including all banks and UPI apps.

DevelopersPage.title: UPI Payment Integration for Indian Developers
DevelopersPage.description: Integrate UPI payments into your Indian website or application with ease. Developer tools for BHIM UPI, NPCI compliant payment solutions.
DevelopersPage.embedWidgetP1: The easiest way to add a UPI payment form to your Indian website is by using our embeddable widget. Just copy and paste the following HTML snippet into your webpage, and a fully functional payment form will appear. It's lightweight, secure, and requires no backend setup on your part. Perfect for Indian e-commerce sites, SaaS platforms, and business websites.
DevelopersPage.embedWidgetP2: The widget will generate a unique payment page on UPI PG. You can adjust the height and width attributes to best fit your site's layout. Supports all major Indian UPI apps including Google Pay, PhonePe, Paytm, and bank UPI apps.
DevelopersPage.deepLinkTitle: Manual UPI Deep Link Integration for Indian Apps
DevelopersPage.deepLinkP1: For more custom integrations in your Indian mobile app or website, you can create UPI deep links (also known as UPI URIs) directly within your application. These links, when clicked on a mobile device, will open the user's default UPI app with the payment details pre-filled. Ideal for Indian fintech startups, e-commerce platforms, and payment gateways.
DevelopersPage.deepLinkP2: The format for a UPI link is as follows:
DevelopersPage.paramPA: Payee Address (Your UPI ID). This is the only mandatory parameter for Indian UPI transactions.
DevelopersPage.paramPN: Payee Name. The name of the person or business receiving the payment in India.
DevelopersPage.paramAM: Transaction Amount. The exact amount to be paid in rupees (e.g., 100.00).
DevelopersPage.paramCU: Currency Code. Should always be "INR" for Indian rupee transactions.
DevelopersPage.paramTN: Transaction Note. A short description of the payment (e.g., 'Service fee', 'Product purchase').
DevelopersPage.deepLinkP3: You can generate this link dynamically on your server or with client-side JavaScript and embed it in a button or hyperlink. Remember to URL-encode the parameter values. This works seamlessly with all Indian UPI apps and banks.
DevelopersPage.qrCodeTitle: Dynamic QR Code Generation for Indian Businesses
DevelopersPage.qrCodeP1: You can also generate QR codes that contain the UPI deep link information. When an Indian customer scans this QR code with their UPI app, the payment details are automatically filled. This is perfect for Indian invoices, product pages, point-of-sale displays, restaurants, and retail stores.
DevelopersPage.qrCodeP2: To do this, take the UPI deep link you constructed and URL-encode it. Then, use it as the data source for any QR code generation library or API. We use and recommend `qrserver.com` for its simplicity and reliability for Indian businesses.
